TODAY IN HISTORY, via $Investopedia; $MSFT  
April 4, 1975 
  
On this day in 1975, childhood friends and computer programmers Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft in a garage space in Albuquerque, N.M.  Allen suggested the name, which was short for micro-computer software. 
  
The pair’s initial work was to program the Altair 8800 microcomputer. They then began developing operating systems, getting a contract from IBM for its personal computer in 1980. Five years later, the company introduced Microsoft Windows, which became the dominant operating system for personal computers to this day.  
  
The success of Microsoft made both Gates and Allen multi-billionaires, and Gates held the title of world’s richest person for several years before he began giving his fortune away. The company they founded is one of the most valuable in the world, with a market capitalization of more than two trillion dollars.  
  
Source: Microsoft; Doug Wilson / Getty Images
